VLIB_updateEWRMeanS32

Detailed Description


Functions

int32_t VLIB_updateEWRMeanS32 (int32_t *restrict runningMean, const uint8_t *restrict newLuma, const uint32_t *restrict mask32packed, const int32_t weight, const uint32_t pixelCount)

Function Documentation

int32_t VLIB_updateEWRMeanS32 ( int32_t *restrict  runningMean,
const uint8_t *restrict  newLuma,
const uint32_t *restrict  mask32packed,
const int32_t  weight,
const uint32_t  pixelCount 
)

Description:
The function VLIB_updateEWRMeanS32() updates the exponential running mean of the luma component of a video. If the foreground mask bit is set, indicating there is obstruction by a foreground object, the running mean will not be updated for this mased region.
Parameters:
[in,out] runningMean Running 32-bit mean (SQ8.23)
[in] newLuma Luma field of captured video (UQ8.0)
[in] mask32packed Packed binary mask indicating the presence of a foreground object (unsigned 32-bit)
[in] weight Blending factor between the old mean value and newest data (SQ0.31)
[in] pixelCount Number of pixels to process (UQ32.0)
Assumptions:
  • I/O buffers are assumed to be double-word aligned and not aliased.
  • The pixelCount must be a multiple of 4.
Implementation Notes:
  • This code is fully interruptible
  • This code is compatible with C64X+ fixed-point processors
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
